result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas J Hamilton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Reckless Driving-Cause Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.62(3).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Bond of $1000 applied to fine/costs/attorney fees, balance due during term of probation.

DNA surcharge and balance of attorney fees due during term of probation.If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
Defendant is granted privileges set forth in Wis Stats 303.08

-Absolute sobriety.
-No controlled substances or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription.
-Random testing.
-No contact with Samuel Krumbiegel or Royal Broman.
-Maintain employment of at least 24 hours per week or attend school.
-Defendant must submit a DNA sample.
-Pay supervision fees.

**Credit for 3 days, if revoked.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: $1,300.00 cash bail applied to fees/costs. Remaining balance due through a payment plan of $50.00/month commencing 1 month after release and continuing to be due until paid in full. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment entered in favor of the governmental entities to which they are due.

records.addlTxt: Atty. John Hawley will accept appointment as counsel for defendant. Copy of complaint/bail form and defendant's phone # provided to Atty. Hawley. Clerk attempted to contact defendant to advise him of appointment but could not leave voicemail.
Status hearing at 05-21-2015 08:45 am

Defendant Nicholas J Hamilton in court.  Patti l Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant states he needs additional time to retain counsel, he is not eligible for the public defender. Court finds good cause to waive time limits. Court will appoint counsel for defendant. He is to pay $150 per mo toward attorney commencing 5/1/2015. Bail to continue.  Status hearing scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 08:45 am.
Case rescheduled from 4/28/2015 to 4/30/2015 to accommodate Court's calendar.
Status hearing at 04-30-2015 08:45 am
Conditions set by court: no contact with any witness' named in complaint.

Defendant Nicholas J Hamilton in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears by video conferencing from Ozaukee County Jail.  Public defender counsel appears with defendant as friend of the court, for purpose of bail hearing only at this time. Def does not qualify for public defender. Court finds probable cause as to complaint issued with warrant. State requests $1000 cash bail with conditions.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing on felony complaint.  Court orders adjournment, allowing time for defendant to decide whether preliminary hearing will be requested.  Status conference scheduled for April 28, 2015 at 08:45 am.
